title: Police confirm remains found in woodland ARE those of Joy Morgan
text:
The body of Joy Morgan (pictured) has been found near Stevenage

A body found in woodland near Stevenage has been identified as that of murdered midwifery student Joy Morgan.

A passer-by found the human remains on Saturday morning, ten months after Miss Morgan went missing.

Fellow church member Shohfah-El Israel was convicted of her murder in August but had never revealed where the body was.

Today Hertfordshire Constabulary confirmed that the body found five days ago was that of Miss Morgan.

'My thoughts are with Joy's family at this difficult time and while nothing can end their pain, I hope that this gives them closure and I am glad that they will now have the opportunity to say goodbye to Joy,' said DCI Justine Jenkins.

The body was found 'just outside of an area previously searched by officers', the police force insisted.

Miss Morgan's mother, Carol Morgan, paid a fresh tribute in which she said: 'She will always be our star'.

'Joy was so beautiful and completely lived up to her name – she brought joy to all our lives,' her mother said.

'Our family has been living a nightmare and we miss her so, so much. Joy was studying to be a midwife and would have graduated by now.

'I know she would have been amazing as a midwife. I was so proud of her and I always will be.'

Police at the scene a wood near Stevenage where human remains were found on Saturday

Shohfah-El Israel, 40, right, received a life sentence with a minimum of 17-years for the murder of Joy Morgan (left) but he has never revealed where her body is

The University of Hertfordshire student was last seen being driven away by her killer Shohfah El-Israel at a church event in Ilford on Boxing Day last year.

She was reported missing on February 7 after failing to return to her studies.

El-Israel, a fellow member of the Israel United In Christ (IUIC) church, was found guilty of her murder at Reading Crown Court in August this year.

The 40-year-old from London is currently serving a life sentence, with a minimum term of 17 years in prison.

The killer, whose birth name is Ajibola Shogbamimu, murdered Miss Morgan after spending time with her together against church rules.

After killing Ms Morgan he attempted to cover his tracks by removing her number from a church Telegram group chat, the court heard, and even kept up the pretence by going to her student house share under the guise of checking on her in the days after she apparently went missing.

He also lied to police when he was arrested, saying he had dropped Ms Morgan off at her student accommodation in Hatfield after the Boxing Day event.

A signal from Ms Morgan's phone, which has never been found, was detected in Israel's car in the Stevenage area on December 28.

The trial jury was told he was most likely 'looking for somewhere to dispose of the body'.

Joy was last seen on December 26 getting into this car with Israel and his wife Chindu

A police tent and cordon at the woodland site where the body was discovered on Saturday

The keys to her accommodation were discovered in the footwell of his car after his arrest in February.

Passing sentence, Judge Michael Soole said: 'Only you know the circumstances of your terrible deed and why you did it.

'The court has heard the most moving personal statement from Joy's mother Carol Morgan, which speaks of Joy's warm, loving and caring personality and character.

'On top of all this must be the very particular and continuing distress and suffering which flows from your cruel and cowardly silence about Joy Morgan's final resting place.'

Speaking outside court, Carol Morgan had pleaded with the killer to reveal the location of the body.

She said: 'Give me my baby back, he knows where she is. The way I hear it he was besotted with her… if he loved her give her back up to us so I can bury my daughter.

'If I get to see her before I die I'll be very grateful.'
description: A passer-by found the human remains in woodland near Stevenage on Saturday morning, ten months after midwifery student Joy Morgan (pictured) went missing.
